data.enText: separate amount

before.chText: 尤与of和不可数名词连用
before.enText: used especially with of and uncountable nouns

data.enText: an amount of sth that has been cut or separated from the rest of it; a standard amount of sth
a piece of string/wood

data.chText: 她在一小片纸上写了点什么。
data.enText: She wrote something on a small piece of paper.
a large piece of land

data.chText: 一块蛋糕 / 奶酪 / 肉
data.enText: a piece of cake/cheese/meat

data.chText: 他把比萨饼切成一口一块的小块。
data.enText: He cut the pizza into bite-sized pieces.
I've got a piece of grit in my eye.
part
one of the bits or parts that sth breaks into

data.chText: 路上到处都是碎玻璃渣。
data.enText: There were tiny pieces of glass all over the road.

data.chText: 小船在岩石上撞得粉碎。
data.enText: The boat had been smashed to pieces on the rocks.
The vase lay in pieces on the floor.
one of the parts that sth is made of
He took the clock to pieces .
a missing piece of the puzzle

data.chText: 桥梁被一部分一部分地拆毁。
data.enText: The bridge was taken down piece by piece .
a 500 piece jigsaw
single item

before.chText: 尤与of和不可数名词连用
before.enText: used especially with of and uncountable nouns

data.enText: a single item of a particular type, especially one that forms part of a set

data.chText: 一件衣服 / 家具 / 行李
data.enText: a piece of clothing/furniture/luggage
a piece of equipment/machinery
a 28-piece dinner service
used with many uncountable nouns to describe a single example or an amount of sth

data.chText: 一条建议 / 信息 / 消息
data.enText: a piece of advice/information/news
an interesting piece of research
Isn't that a piece of luck ?

data.chText: （文章、艺术品、音乐作品等的）一件，一篇，一首，一支
data.enText: a single item of writing, art, music, etc. that sb has produced or created

data.chText: 一件艺术品、一支乐曲、一首诗歌等
data.enText: a piece of art/music/poetry, etc.

data.chText: 他们演奏了巴赫和亨德尔的几支曲子。
data.enText: They performed pieces by Bach and Handel.

data.chText: 他们家中珍藏了一些精美的艺术品。
data.enText: They have some beautiful pieces (= works of art, etc.) in their home.
news article
an article in a newspaper or magazine or a broadcast on television or radio

data.chText: 你看了今天报纸上她写的关于互联网的文章没有？
data.enText: Did you see her piece about the Internet in the paper today?
coin
a coin of the value mentioned
a 50p piece
a five-cent piece
in chess, etc.
one of the small figures or objects that you move around in games such as chess
share of sth
a part or share of sth
companies seeking a piece of the market
gun
a gun
distance
a short distance

data.chText: 她住在路那头离这里不远的地方。
data.enText: She lives down the road a piece from here.

data.text: You will find other compounds ending in piece at their place in the alphabet.
其他以piece结尾的复合词可在各字母中的适当位置查到。

data.enText: a/some piece of work

data.chText: 了不起的人；与众不同的人
data.enText: used to express the fact that you admire sb or find them amusing, often when they have done sth that surprises you

data.chText: 你知道吗，杰克？你真了不起。
data.enText: You're some piece of work, Jack, do you know that?
fall to pieces

before.enText: usually used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to become very old and in bad condition because of long use

data.chText: 我们的汽车已破旧不堪，我们已用了它很久了。
data.enText: Our car is falling to pieces, we've had it so long.

before.enText: of a person, an organization, a plan, etc.

data.enText: to stop working; to be destroyed

data.chText: 他担心没有了他企业将会倒闭。
data.enText: He's worried the business will fall to pieces without him.
give sb a piece of your mind

data.chText: 表明对某人的行为不满；向某人表示恼火
data.enText: to tell sb that you disapprove of their behaviour or are angry with them
go to pieces
to be so upset or afraid that you cannot manage to live or work normally
(all) in one piece

data.chText: 安然无恙（尤指旅行或经历危险之后）
data.enText: safe; not damaged or hurt, especially after a journey or dangerous experience

data.chText: 他们能平安返家真是幸运。
data.enText: They were lucky to get home in one piece.
(all) of a piece
all the same or similar
The houses are all of a piece.
all at the same time

data.chText: 整所房子是在1754年建造完成的。
data.enText: The house was built all of a piece in 1754.
pick/pull/tear sb/sth to pieces/shreds

data.chText: 严厉斥责；痛斥；批评得体无完肤
data.enText: to criticize sb, or their work or ideas, very severely
a piece of cake

data.chText: 轻而易举的事；举手之劳
data.enText: a thing that is very easy to do
a piece of piss

data.chText: 小菜一碟；轻而易举的事
data.enText: a thing that is very easy to do
bits and pieces/bobs
small objects or items of various kinds

data.chText: 她把她零零碎碎的东西都塞进了一只包里就走了。
data.enText: She stuffed all her bits and pieces into a bag and left.

data.id-g-sent: how long is a piece of string

data.enText: a nasty piece of work

data.chText: 恶棍；令人讨厌的人；靠不住的人
data.enText: a person who is unpleasant, unkind or dishonest
pick up the pieces
to return or to help sb return to a normal situation, particularly after a shock or a disaster

data.chText: 你不能替孩子过活，只能在出现问题时帮忙解决。
data.enText: You cannot live your children's lives for them; you can only be there to pick up the pieces when things go wrong.
a piece/slice/share of the pie
a share of sth such as money, profits, etc.
say your piece
to say exactly what you feel or think
the villain of the piece
the person or thing that is responsible for all the trouble in a situation
piece sth↔together

data.chText: 组合资料（以便了解情况）
data.enText: to understand a story, situation, etc. by taking all the facts and details about it and putting them together

data.chText: 警方正努力理清她在死亡之前数小时的情况。
data.enText: Police are trying to piece together the last hours of her life.
to put all the separate parts of sth together to make a complete whole
to piece together a jigsaw

data.chText: 许多表示少量、一个等的词可用以修饰不可数名词，但必须选择能与该物质名词搭配得当的词。
data.enText: If you want to talk about a small amount or one example of something that is normally an uncountable noun, there is a range of words you can use. You must choose the right one to go with the substance you are talking about.

data.chText: piece和bit（非正式英国英语）是十分通用的词，可与大多数不可数名词连用：
data.enText: Piece and ( BrE informal ) bit are very general words and can be used with most uncountable nouns.

data.chText: 一张纸；一块木头；一根绳子；一块蛋糕；一个水果；一块肉；一件工作；一项研究；一个忠告
data.enText: a piece of paper/wood/string/cake/fruit/meat/work/research/advice

data.chText: 一小片纸；一点工作；一小块巧克力；一点运气
data.enText: a bit of paper/work/chocolate/luck
A slice is a thin flat piece.

data.chText: 一片面包／蛋糕／萨拉米香肠／干酪／馅饼／苹果
data.enText: a slice of bread/cake/salami/cheese/pie/apple
( figurative )

data.chText: （比喻）反映现实生活的电影（戏剧或书）
data.enText: a slice of life
A chunk is a thick, solid piece.
a chunk of cheese/bread/rock
a chunk of land (= a fairly large piece)

data.chText: lump指无一定形状的一块、一团：
data.enText: A lump is a piece of something solid without any particular shape.
a lump of coal/rock/mud
A fragment is a very small piece of something that is broken or damaged.
fragments of glass
( figurative )
fragments of conversation

data.chText: 该词亦可与可数名词连用表示小部分：
data.enText: It can also be used with countable nouns to mean a small part of something.
a fragment of the story
A speck is a tiny piece of powder.
a speck of dust/dirt
You can also say
a speck of light
Drop is used with liquids.

data.chText: 一滴水／雨／血／牛奶／威士忌酒
data.enText: a drop of water/rain/blood/milk/whisky
A pinch is as much as you can hold between your finger and thumb.
a pinch of salt/cinnamon

data.chText: portion指够一人用的一份、一客：
data.enText: A portion is enough for one person.
a portion of chicken

data.chText: 要是新机场开始修建，外国公司都会来插一手捞好处。
data.enText: Foreign firms will all want a piece of the action if the new airport goes ahead.

data.enText: She stuffed all her bits and pieces into a bag and left.
How long is a piece of string?

data.chText: 一条线有多长（意指没有确切的答案）
data.enText: used to say that there is no definite answer to a question
‘How long will it take?’ ‘How long's a piece of string?’

data.enText: a person who is unpleasant, unkind or dishonest

example: he wore his firearm in a shoulder holster

tr: game equipment consisting of an object used in playing certain board games
example: he taught me to set up the men on the chess board
he sacrificed a piece to get a strategic advantage

tr: a work of art of some artistic value
example: this store sells only objets d'art
it is not known who created this piece

tr: a separate part of a whole
example: an important piece of the evidence

tr: an item that is an instance of some type
example: he designed a new piece of equipment
she bought a lovely piece of china
it is down the road a piece
he wrote an interesting piece on Iran
the children acted out a comic piece to amuse the guests

tr: a musical work that has been created
example: the composition is written in four movements
it was a nice piece of work
he had a bit of good luck

tr: a serving that has been cut from a larger portion
example: a piece of pie
a slice of bread

tr: a portion of a natural object
example: they analyzed the river into three parts
he needed a piece of granite
a slice of the company's revenue

tr: a period of indeterminate length (usually short) marked by some action or condition
example: he was here for a little while
I need to rest for a piece
a spell of good weather
a patch of bad weather
She pieced the china cup
He pieced at the sandwich all morning
She never eats a full meal--she just nibbles
piece the broken pieces of thread, slivers, and rovings

tr: to join or unite the pieces of
example: patch the skirt

tr: create by putting components or members together
example: She pieced a quilt
He tacked together some verses
They set up a committee

value.def: A piece of something is an amount of it that has been broken off, torn off, or cut off.

example.ex: ...a piece of cake.
example.tran: 一块蛋糕

example.ex: ...a piece of wood.
example.tran: 一截木头

example.ex: ...a few words scrawled on a piece of paper...
example.tran: 潦草写在一张纸上的几个词

example.ex: Cut the ham into pieces...
example.tran: 把火腿切成片。

example.ex: Do you want another piece?
example.tran: 你还想再来一块吗？

value.tran: （断下、撕下或切下的）块，片，段，截

value.def: A piece of an object is one of the individual parts or sections which it is made of, especially a part that can be removed.

example.ex: ...assembling objects out of standard pieces...
example.tran: 用标准部件组装物品

example.ex: The equipment was taken down the shaft in pieces.
example.tran: 该设备被拆卸成几部分送下了井。

value.def: A piece of land is an area of land.

example.ex: People struggle to get the best piece of land.
example.tran: 人们竞相争夺最好的土地。

value.def: You can use piece of with many uncount nouns to refer to an individual thing of a particular kind. For example, you can refer to some advice as a piece of advice.

example.ex: When I produced this piece of work, my lecturers were very critical...
example.tran: 当我拿出这件作品时，我的讲师们提出了诸多批评意见。

example.ex: It is a highly complex piece of legislation.
example.tran: 它是一项非常复杂的法规。

example.ex: ...an interesting piece of information.
example.tran: 一则有趣的信息

example.ex: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
example.tran: 一台灵敏的探测辐射设备

example.ex: ...a sturdy piece of furniture...
example.tran: 一件结实的家具

example.ex: What essential piece of clothing would you take?
example.tran: 你会带哪件必不可少的衣服呢？

value.tran: （与不可数名词连用）桩，项，条，件

value.def: You can refer to an article in a newspaper or magazine, some music written by someone, a broadcast, or a play as a piece .

example.ex: I disagree with Andrew Russell over his piece on British Rail.
example.tran: 我不同意安德鲁·拉塞尔那篇关于英国铁路公司的文章。

example.ex: ...a vaguely familiar orchestral piece...
example.tran: 隐约有点熟悉的一首管弦乐

example.ex: The day after his death there was a piece about him on television.
example.tran: 他去世的第二天，电视上播放了一段关于他的报道。

value.tran: （报纸或杂志上的一篇）文章；（一首或一部）音乐作品；（一段）广播节目；（一出）戏剧

value.def: You can refer to a work of art as a piece .

example.ex: Each piece is unique, an exquisite painting of a real person, done on ivory...
example.tran: 每一件艺术品都是绘在象牙上的精美绝伦的真人肖像，都是独一无二的。

example.ex: None of the pieces is insured.
example.tran: 没有一件艺术品上过保险。

value.def: You can refer to specific coins as pieces. For example, a 10p piece is a coin that is worth 10p.
The pieces which you use when you play a board game such as chess are the specially made objects which you move around on the board.
A piece of something is part of it or a share of it.

example.ex: They got a small piece of the net profits and a screen credit.
example.tran: 他们得到了一小部分纯利润以及电影演职人员字幕中的署名权。

example.ex: ...the disclosure that Texas Air might sell a piece or all of Continental.
example.tran: 得克萨斯航空公司可能会卖掉部分或整个大陆航空公司这一消息的披露

value.def: If you give someone a piece of your mind, you tell them very clearly that you think they have behaved badly.

example.ex: How very thoughtless. I'll give him a piece of my mind.
example.tran: 真是太没头脑了，我要告诉他我很生气。

value.def: If something with several different parts is all of a piece, each part is consistent with the others. If one thing is of a piece with another, it is consistent with it.

example.ex: At its peak in the Thirties, Underground design and architecture was all of a piece...
example.tran: 在30年代的顶峰时期，地铁的设计和建筑风格都一模一样。

example.ex: The essays that Parsons completed in the latter part of his life are of a piece with his earlier work.
example.tran: 帕森斯后半生完成的文章和他的早期著作一脉相承。

value.def: If someone or something is still in one piece after a dangerous journey or experience, they are safe and not damaged or hurt.

example.ex: ...providing that my brother gets back alive and in one piece from his mission.
example.tran: 如果我哥哥执行任务能够平安归来

value.tran: 安然无恙的；完好无损的

value.def: If you say your piece, you say everything you want to say about a particular matter without being interrupted, although people may be wanting to express opposing views.

example.ex: I'll answer your questions when I've said my piece.
example.tran: 说完我想说的，我会回答你的问题。

value.tran: 说自己想说的话；（毫不保留且不受打断地）发表意见

value.def: You use to pieces in expressions such as 'smash to pieces', and mainly in British English 'fall to pieces' or 'take something to pieces', when you are describing how something is broken or comes apart so that it is in separate pieces.

example.ex: If the shell had hit the boat, it would have blown it to pieces...
example.tran: 如果炮弹击中了小船，它早就被炸成碎片了。

example.ex: He took it all to pieces, cleaned it inside and out and put it together again...
example.tran: 他把它全拆了，里外清洁了一下，然后又装了起来。

example.ex: Do you wear your old clothes until they fall to pieces?
example.tran: 你一直穿你的旧衣服，直到穿烂了为止吗？

value.tran: 成碎片地；散了架地；成组件地

value.def: If you go to pieces, you are so upset or nervous that you lose control of yourself and cannot do what you should do.

example.ex: She's a strong woman, but she nearly went to pieces when Arnie died.
example.tran: 她是个坚强的女性，但阿尼去世时，她几乎崩溃了。

value.def: If someone tears you to pieces ,pulls your work to pieces, or picks your work to pieces, they criticize you or your work very severely.

example.ex: He made numerous errors of fact and was torn to pieces during the subsequent question time...
example.tran: 他犯了数不清的事实错误，并在随后的答疑时间中被批得体无完肤。

example.ex: Every error is captured, every decision picked to pieces.
example.tran: 每个错误都会被抓住，每个决定都会被骂得一无是处。

value.tran: 把…说得一钱不值；把…批得体无完肤

value.def: If you say that someone is a nasty piece of work, you mean that they are very unkind or unpleasant.

trans: 小菜一碟；非常容易的事
作品；一件工作；一项工作；一份工作
收拾残局；努力恢复正常
面包；一片面包；一块面包
破碎，成碎片 , (信念、意见等)不一致，分歧
粗（最初）加工部分；粗加工工件
布疋；零担货物；布匹；件货物；件货
fall to pieces (英国英语中作 fall to bits) 同 fall apart
试件；试样；试片；试材；试验片
